Recipe.Title: Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo
Recipe.RecipeIntroduction: This is a family favorite. A creamy, cheesy Alfredo dish, great with a salad and garlic bread.

ToolTip.Text: Italian Seasoning is a spice mixture used to flavour many Italian dishes. Most contain basil, oregano, rosemary, and thyme.
Also known as 'Half cream', this is a blend of blend of equal parts whole milk and light cream. It is usually sold with milk.
For this recipe, a small handful of salt should do. Put it in the water and bring it to a boil. This adds flavour to the pasta itself.
Al dente means to cook until the pasta is done or 'firm to bite'. This occurs just after the white of the pasta center has disappeared.

Most ovens will have a dial with numbers between 1 and 9. In that case, medium heat would be 5 on the knob. Generally, you want to choose the middle number. Every oven is different however, so pay attention - If your food consistently cooks too quickly, reduce the knob. If it consistently cooks too slow, increase the knob.

RecipeStep.StepText: Cut the 6 Chicken Breast Halves into cubes
RecipeStep.Title: Cube Chicken Breast

RecipeStep.StepText: Mince the 4 Garlic Gloves. Then, dice the onion and the 3 roma tomatoes.
RecipeStep.Title: Mince Garlic, Dice Onion & Tomatoes

RecipeStep.StepText: In a large skillet over medium heat combine chicken, 2 tablespoons butter, 2 cloves garlic (About half of the minced garlic), and 1 tbsp. Italian seasoning. Cook until chicken is no longer pink inside. Remove from skillet and set aside.
RecipeStep.Title: Cook Chicken

RecipeStep.StepText: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add 1 pound fettuccini pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain. Note that you should continue on to the next step while you wait for the pasta to cook!
RecipeStep.Title: Boil Fettuccini

RecipeStep.StepText: Meanwhile, melt 4 tablespoons butter in the same skillet. Saute the diced onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, and the 8 ounce package of sliced mushrooms until the onions are transparent.
RecipeStep.Title: Start Sauce - Add butter, onion, garlic, and mushrooms

RecipeStep.StepText: Stir in 1/3 cup flour, 1 tbsp. salt and 3/4 tsp. pepper; cook 2 minutes. Slowly add 3 cups milk and 1 cup half-and-half, stirring until smooth and creamy. Stir in 3/4 cup Parmesan and 8 ounces of Colby-Monterey Jack cheeses; stir until cheese is melted.
RecipeStep.Title: Add Flour, Salt, Pepper, Milk, and Cheese

RecipeStep.StepText: Stir in chicken mixture, 3 diced roma tomatoes and 1/2 cup sour cream. Serve over cooked fettuccini.
RecipeStep.Title: Add Chicken Mixture, Tomatoes, & Sour Cream
